values.name: ORACLE
values.description: Use the TaskRunners system clock for the current time.

values.name: SYSCLOCK
values.description: Use the on-chain SYSCLOCK for the current time.

values.name: CHAIN_ETHEREUM
values.description: Use the Ethereum blockchain for fetching Curve Finance data

enums.name: Method
enums.description: An enumeration representing the types of HTTP requests available to make.

values.name: METHOD_UNKOWN
values.description: Unset HTTP method will default to METHOD_GET

enums.name: AggregationMethod
enums.description: The methods of combining a list of numerical results.

values.name: MIN
values.description: Grab the minimum value of the results.

values.name: MAX
values.description: Grab the maximum value of the results.

values.name: SUM
values.description: Sum up all of the results.

values.name: MEDIAN
values.description: Grab the median of the results.

enums.name: Method
enums.description: Specifies the method to use for fetching Maple Finance data.

values.name: METHOD_SYRUP_USDC_FAIR_PRICE
values.description: Fetch the fair price of syrupUSDC in the Maple Finance ecosystem.

enums.name: Strategy
enums.description:
Strategy specifies the method used to determine the price of USDY.
/
/ - STRATEGY_FAIR_VALUE: Computes the price based on a fair value model.
/ - STRATEGY_MARKET: Fetches the price directly from the market.

messages.name: OracleJob
messages.description: Represnts a list of tasks to be performed by a switchboard oracle.

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: The chain of tasks to perform for this OracleJob.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: weight
fields.description:
The weight to assign to this job's result when aggregating multiple job results. A higher
/ weight means this job's result will have more influence on the final aggregated value. This
/ value must be greater than or equal to 0.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: AddTask
messages.description:
This task will add a numerical input by a scalar value from a job of subtasks, an aggregator, or a big.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result output from a scalar value, an aggregator, a job of subtasks or a big.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by adding by a job of subtasks.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"addTask":{"job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by an aggregator.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"addTask":{"aggregatorPubkey":"GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR"}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by a big.

```json
{"tasks":[{"cacheTask":{"cacheItems":[{"variableName":"TEN","job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}]}},{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"addTask":{"big":"${TEN}"}}]}
```

fields.name: scalar
fields.description: Specifies a scalar to add by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Specifies an aggregator to add by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: job
fields.description: A job whose result is computed before adding our numerical input by that result.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: AnchorFetchTask
messages.description: Load a parse an Anchor based solana account.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Owning program of the account to parse.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: account_address
fields.description: The account to parse.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: BitFluxTask
messages.description:
Fetch the current swap price from a BitFlux pool.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The swap price between the specified input and output tokens.

_**Example**_: Fetch the swap price using a custom RPC provider

```json
{
"bitFluxTask": {
"provider": "https://my-custom-rpc.example.com",
"poolAddress": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000",
"inToken": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000",
"outToken": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"
}
}
```

fields.name: provider
fields.description: Optional. The RPC endpoint to use for requests. If not specified, a default RPC will be used.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pool_address
fields.description: The address of the BitFlux pool.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: in_token
fields.description: The address of the input token.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: out_token
fields.description: The address of the output token.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: BoundTask
messages.description:
Bound the running result to an upper/lower bound. This is typically the last task in an OracleJob.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result.

_**Returns**_: The running result bounded to an upper or lower bound if it exceeds a given threshold.

_**Example**_: Bound the running result to a value between 0.90 and 1.10

```json
{ "boundTask": { "lowerBoundValue": "0.90","onExceedsLowerBoundValue": "0.90","upperBoundValue": "1.10","onExceedsUpperBoundValue": "1.10" } }
```

fields.name: lower_bound
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute for the lower bound value.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: lower_bound_value
fields.description: The value to use for the lower bound. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: upper_bound
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute for the upper bound value.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: upper_bound_value
fields.description: The value to use for the upper bound. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_exceeds_upper_bound
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute if the upper bound is exceeded.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_exceeds_upper_bound_value
fields.description: The value to use if the upper bound is exceeded. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_exceeds_lower_bound
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute if the lower bound is exceeded.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_exceeds_lower_bound_value
fields.description: The value to use if the lower bound is exceeded. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: BufferLayoutParseTask
messages.description: Return the deserialized value from a stringified buffer.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: The buffer offset to start deserializing from.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: endian
fields.description: The endianness of the stored value.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of value to deserialize.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CacheTask
messages.description:
Execute a job and store the result in a variable to reference later.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The input

_**Example**_: CacheTask storing ${ONE} = 1

```json
{ "cacheTask": { "cacheItems": [ { "variableName": "ONE", "job": { "tasks": [ { "valueTask": { "value": 1 } } ] } } ] } }
```

fields.name: cache_items
fields.description: A list of cached variables to reference in the job with `${VARIABLE_NAME}`.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: variable_name
fields.description: The name of the variable to store in cache to reference later with `${VARIABLE_NAME}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: job
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute to yield the value to store in cache.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: op
fields.description: The type of operator to use on the left (lhs) and right (rhs) operand.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: lhs
fields.description: OracleJob where the executed result is equal to the left hand side operand.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: lhs_value
fields.description: String or `${CACHE_KEY}` representing the left hand side operand.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: rhs
fields.description: OracleJob where the executed result is equal to the right hand side operand.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: rhs_value
fields.description: String or `${CACHE_KEY}` representing the right hand side operand.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_true
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute if the condition evaluates to true.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_true_value
fields.description: The result to use if the condition evaluates to true. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_false
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute if the condition evaluates to false.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_false_value
fields.description: The result to use if the condition evaluates to false. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_failure
fields.description: The OracleJob to execute if the condition fails to evaluate.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_failure_value
fields.description: The result to use if the condition fails to evaluate. Can be set to a `${CACHE_KEY}`.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ConditionalTask
messages.description:
This task will run the `attempt` on the subtasks in an effort to produce a valid numerical result. If `attempt`. fails to produce an acceptable result, `on_failure` subtasks will be run instead.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result output from a task.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result, else run `on_failure` subtasks.

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result from the conditionalTask's subtasks, else `on_failure` returns the numerical result from its subtasks.

```json
{"conditionalTask":{"attempt":[{"tasks":[{"jupiterSwapTask":{"inTokenAddress":"EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v","outTokenAddress":"DUALa4FC2yREwZ59PHeu1un4wis36vHRv5hWVBmzykCJ"}}]}],"onFailure":[{"lpExchangeRateTask":{"orcaPoolAddress":"7yJ4gMRJhEoCR48aPE3EAWRmCoygakik81ZS1sajaTnE"}}]}}
```

fields.name: attempt
fields.description: A list of subtasks to process in an attempt to produce a valid numerical result.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: on_failure
fields.description:
A list of subtasks that will be run if `attempt` subtasks are unable to produce an acceptable
/ result.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: CronParseTask
messages.description:
Return a timestamp from a crontab instruction.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A timestamp

_**Example**_: Return the unix timestamp for the on-chain SYSCLOCK

```json
{"cronParseTask":{"cronPattern":"* * * * * *","clockOffset":0,"clock":"SYSCLOCK"}}
```

_**Example**_: Return the unix timestamp for next friday at 5pm UTC

```json
{"cronParseTask":{"cronPattern":"0 17 * * 5","clockOffset":0,"clock":0}}
```

fields.name: cron_pattern
fields.description: The cron pattern to parse.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: clock_offset
fields.description: The timestamp offset to calculate the next run.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: clock
fields.description: Use the TaskRunner's clock or the on-chain SYSCLOCK.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CurveFinanceTask

fields.name: chain
fields.description: Required. Specifies which blockchain to use when reading information from Curve Finance.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: provider
fields.description: Optional. The RPC endpoint to use for blockchain requests. If not specified, a default RPC will be used which may have rate limits.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pool_address
fields.description: The on-chain address of the Curve Finance pool to fetch pricing data from.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: out_decimals
fields.description: The number of decimal places to include in the returned price value.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: DivideTask
messages.description:
This task will divide a numerical input by a scalar value from a job of subtasks, an aggregator, or a big.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result output from a scalar value, an aggregator, a job of subtasks or a big.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by dividing by a job of subtasks.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"divideTask":{"job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by dividing by an aggregator.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"divideTask":{"aggregatorPubkey":"GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR"}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by dividing by a big.

```json
{"tasks":[{"cacheTask":{"cacheItems":[{"variableName":"TEN","job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}]}},{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"divideTask":{"big":"${TEN}"}}]}
```

fields.name: scalar
fields.description: Specifies a basic scalar denominator to divide by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Specifies another aggregator resut to divide by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: job
fields.description: A job whose result is computed before dividing our numerical input by that result.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ExponentTask
FragmetricTask
messages.description:
Fetch the current price for Fragmetric liquid restaking tokens.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The current price of the specified Fragmetric token relative to SOL (1.0 = 1 SOL)

_**Example**_: Fetch the fragSOL token price

```json
{ "fragmetricTask": { "token": "TOKEN_FRAG_SOL" } }
```

fields.name: token
fields.description: The Fragmetric token to fetch the price for
fields.label: optional

messages.name: HttpTask
messages.description:
The adapter will report the text body of a successful HTTP request to the
specified url, or return an error if the response status code is greater
than or equal to 400.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: String representation of the http response.

_**Example**_: Basic HttpTask

```json
{"httpTask": {"url": "https://mywebsite.org/path"} }
```

_**Example**_: HttpTask example with headers

```json
{ "httpTask": { "url": "https://mywebsite.org/path", "method": "METHOD_POST", "headers": [ { "key": "MY_HEADER_KEY", "value": "MY_HEADER_VALUE" } ], "body": "{\"MY_BODY_KEY\":\"MY_BODY_VALUE\"}" } }
```

fields.name: url
fields.description: A string containing the URL to direct this HTTP request to.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: method
fields.description: The type of HTTP request to make.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: headers
fields.description: A list of headers to add to this HttpTask.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: body
fields.description: A stringified body (if any) to add to this HttpTask.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Header
messages.description: An object that represents a header to add to an HTTP request.

fields.name: key
fields.description: A header key such as `Authorization` or `Content-Type`
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: A value for the given header key like `Basic MYAUTHKEY` or `application/json`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: JsonParseTask
messages.description:
The adapter walks the path specified and returns the value found at that result. If returning
JSON data from the HttpGet or HttpPost adapters, you must use this adapter to parse the response.

_**Input**_: String representation of a JSON object.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Parses the price field from a JSON object

```json
{"jsonParse": {"path": "$.price"} }
```

fields.name: path
fields.description:
JSONPath formatted path to the element. https://t.ly/uLtw
/ https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsonpath-plus
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregation_method
fields.description: The technique that will be used to aggregate the results if walking the specified path returns multiple numerical results.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: JupiterSwapTask
messages.description:
Fetch the simulated price for a swap on JupiterSwap.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The swap price on Jupiter for a given input and output token mint address.

_**Example**_: Fetch the JupiterSwap price for exchanging 1 SOL into USDC.

```json
{ "jupiterSwapTask": { "inTokenAddress": "So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112", "outTokenAddress": "EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v" } }
```

_**Example**_: Fetch the JupiterSwap price for exchanging 1000 SOL into USDC.

```json
{ "jupiterSwapTask": { "inTokenAddress": "So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112", "outTokenAddress": "EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v", "baseAmount": "1000" } }
```

fields.name: in_token_address
fields.description: The input token address.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: out_token_address
fields.description: The output token address.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: allow_list
fields.description: A list of AMM markets to allow.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: deny_list
fields.description: A list of AMM markets to deny.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: base_amount
fields.description: The amount of `in_token_address` tokens to swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: quote_amount
fields.description: The amount of `out_token_address` tokens to swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: base_amount_string
fields.description: The amount of `in_token_address` tokens to swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: quote_amount_string
fields.description: The amount of `out_token_address` tokens to swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: slippage
fields.description: The allowable slippage on the swap in decimal form (e.g. 0.5 is 0.5% slippage)
fields.label: optional

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of Jupiter AMM labels to allow or deny (e.g. 'Raydium', 'Orca')
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: LendingRateTask
messages.description: Fetch the lending rates for various Solana protocols

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: 01, apricot, francium, jet, larix, mango, port, solend, tulip
fields.label: optional

fields.name: asset_mint
fields.description: A token mint address supported by the chosen protocol
fields.label: optional

messages.name: LlmTask
LpExchangeRateTask
messages.description:
Fetch the current swap price for a given liquidity pool

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The swap price for a given AMM pool.

_**Example**_: Fetch the exchange rate from the Orca SOL/USDC pool

```json
{ "lpExchangeRateTask": { "orcaPoolAddress": "APDFRM3HMr8CAGXwKHiu2f5ePSpaiEJhaURwhsRrUUt9" } }
```

_**Example**_: Fetch the exchange rate from the Raydium SOL/USDC pool

```json
{ "lpExchangeRateTask": { "raydiumPoolAddress": "58oQChx4yWmvKdwLLZzBi4ChoCc2fqCUWBkwMihLYQo2" } }
```

fields.name: in_token_address
fields.description: Used alongside mercurial_pool_address to specify the input token for a swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: out_token_address
fields.description: Used alongside mercurial_pool_address to specify the output token for a swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: mercurial_pool_address
fields.description: Mercurial finance pool address. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/mercurial-finance/stable-swap-n-pool-js
fields.label: optional

fields.name: saber_pool_address
fields.description: Saber pool address. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/saber-hq/saber-registry-dist
fields.label: optional

fields.name: orca_pool_token_mint_address
fields.description: @deprecated** Use orcaPoolAddress
fields.label: optional

fields.name: raydium_pool_address
fields.description: The Raydium liquidity pool ammId. A full list can be found here: https://raydium.io/pools
fields.label: optional

fields.name: orca_pool_address
fields.description:
Pool address for an Orca LP pool or whirlpool.
/ A full list of Orca LP pools can be found here: https://www.orca.so/pools
fields.label: optional

fields.name: port_reserve_address
fields.description: The Port reserve pubkey. A full list can be found here: https://api-v1.port.finance/reserves
fields.label: optional

messages.name: LpTokenPriceTask
messages.description:
Fetch LP token price info from a number of supported exchanges.

See our blog post on [Fair LP Token Oracles](/blog/2022/01/20/Fair-LP-Token-Oracles)

*NOTE**: This is not the swap price but the price of the underlying LP token.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The price of an LP token for a given AMM pool.

_**Example**_: Fetch the Orca LP token price of the SOL/USDC pool

```json
{ "lpTokenPriceTask": { "orcaPoolAddress": "APDFRM3HMr8CAGXwKHiu2f5ePSpaiEJhaURwhsRrUUt9" } }
```

_**Example**_: Fetch the fair price Orca LP token price of the SOL/USDC pool

```json
{ "lpTokenPriceTask": { "orcaPoolAddress": "APDFRM3HMr8CAGXwKHiu2f5ePSpaiEJhaURwhsRrUUt9", "useFairPrice": true, "priceFeedAddresses": [ "GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR", "BjUgj6YCnFBZ49wF54ddBVA9qu8TeqkFtkbqmZcee8uW" ] } }
```

_**Example**_: Fetch the fair price Raydium LP token price of the SOL/USDC pool

```json
{ "lpTokenPriceTask": { "raydiumPoolAddress": "58oQChx4yWmvKdwLLZzBi4ChoCc2fqCUWBkwMihLYQo2", "useFairPrice": true,"priceFeedAddresses": ["GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR","BjUgj6YCnFBZ49wF54ddBVA9qu8TeqkFtkbqmZcee8uW" ] } }
```

fields.name: mercurial_pool_address
fields.description: Mercurial finance pool address. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/mercurial-finance/stable-swap-n-pool-js
fields.label: optional

fields.name: saber_pool_address
fields.description: Saber pool address. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/saber-hq/saber-registry-dist
fields.label: optional

fields.name: orca_pool_address
fields.description: Orca pool address. A full list can be found here: https://www.orca.so/pools
fields.label: optional

fields.name: raydium_pool_address
fields.description: The Raydium liquidity pool ammId. A full list can be found here: https://raydium.io/pools
fields.label: optional

fields.name: price_feed_addresses
fields.description: A list of Switchboard aggregator accounts used to calculate the fair LP price. This ensures the price is based on the previous round to mitigate flash loan price manipulation.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: price_feed_jobs
fields.description: A list of OracleJobs to execute in order to yield the price feed jobs to use for the fair price formula.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: use_fair_price
fields.description: If enabled and price_feed_addresses provided, the oracle will calculate the fair LP price based on the liquidity pool reserves. See our blog post for more information: https://switchboardxyz.medium.com/fair-lp-token-oracles-94a457c50239
fields.label: optional

messages.name: LstHistoricalYieldTask

fields.name: lst_mint
fields.description: Required. The LST mint address for which historical yield data is queried.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: operation
fields.description: Required. The statistical operation to apply to the historical yield dataset.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: epochs
fields.description:
Optional. The number of epochs to sample for the computation.
/ - If `epochs = 0`, all available historical data will be used.
/ - If `epochs > 0`, only the last `epochs` entries will be included.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: MangoPerpMarketTask
messages.description: Fetch the current price for a Mango perpetual market

fields.name: perp_market_address
fields.description: Mainnet address for a mango perpetual market. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/blockworks-foundation/mango-client-v3/blob/main/src/ids.json
fields.label: optional

messages.name: MapleFinanceTask
messages.description:
Fetch pricing information for Maple Finance assets.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The requested price or value based on the specified method.

_**Example**_: Fetch the syrupUSDC fair price from Maple Finance

```json
{ "mapleFinanceTask": { "method": "METHOD_SYRUP_USDC_FAIR_PRICE" } }
```

fields.name: method
fields.description: The specific method to use for this task.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: MaxTask
messages.description:
Returns the maximum value of all the results returned by the provided subtasks and subjobs. Nested tasks or jobs must return a Number.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the maximum numerical result from 3 tasks.

```json
{"maxTask": {"tasks": [{"valueTask": {"value": 10}},{"valueTask": {"value": 20}},{"valueTask": {"value": 30}}]}}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the maximum numerical result from 3 jobs.

```json
{"maxTask": {"jobs": [{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.com/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSDT"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.us/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://api-pub.bitfinex.com/v2/tickers?symbols=tSOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$[0][7]"}}]}]}}
```

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: A list of subtasks to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: A list of subjobs to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: MeanTask
messages.description:
Returns the mean (average) of all the results returned by the provided subtasks and subjobs. Nested tasks or jobs must return a Number.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the mean numerical result of 3 tasks.

```json
{"meanTask": {"tasks": [{"valueTask": {"value": 10}},{"valueTask": {"value": 20}},{"valueTask": {"value": 30}}]}}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the mean numerical result of 3 jobs.

```json
{"meanTask": {"jobs": [{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.com/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSDT"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.us/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://api-pub.bitfinex.com/v2/tickers?symbols=tSOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$[0][7]"}}]}]}}
```

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: A list of subtasks to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: A list of subjobs to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: MedianTask
messages.description:
Returns the median (middle) of all the results returned by the provided subtasks and subjobs. Nested tasks must return a Number.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the median numerical result of 3 tasks.

```json
{"medianTask": {"tasks": [{"valueTask": {"value": 10}},{"valueTask": {"value": 20}},{"valueTask": {"value": 30}}]}}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the median numerical result of 3 jobs.

```json
{"medianTask": {"jobs": [{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.com/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSDT"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.us/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://api-pub.bitfinex.com/v2/tickers?symbols=tSOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$[0][7]"}}]}]}}
```

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: A list of subtasks to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: A list of subjobs to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: min_successful_required
fields.description: The minimum number of values before a successful median can be yielded.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: max_range_percent
fields.description: The maximum range between the minimum and maximum values before a successful median can be yielded.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: MeteoraSwapTask
messages.description: Grab the swap price from a Meteora pool.

fields.name: pool
fields.description: The address of the pool.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: type
fields.description: The pool type.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: MinTask
messages.description:
Returns the minimum value of all the results returned by the provided subtasks and subjobs. Nested tasks or jobs must return a Number.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the minimum numerical result from 3 tasks.

```json
{"minTask": {"tasks": [{"valueTask": {"value": 10}},{"valueTask": {"value": 20}},{"valueTask": {"value": 30}}]}}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the minimum numerical result from 3 jobs.

```json
{"minTask": {"jobs": [{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.com/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSDT"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://www.binance.us/api/v3/ticker/price?symbol=SOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$.price"}}]},{"tasks": [{"httpTask": {"url": "https://api-pub.bitfinex.com/v2/tickers?symbols=tSOLUSD"}},{"jsonParseTask": {"path": "$[0][7]"}}]}]}}
```

fields.name: tasks
fields.description: A list of subtasks to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: jobs
fields.description: A list of subjobs to process and produce a list of result values.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: MultiplyTask
messages.description:
This task will multiply a numerical input by a scalar value from a job of subtasks, an aggregator, or a big.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result output from a scalar value, an aggregator, a job of subtasks or a big.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by a job of subtasks.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"multiplyTask":{"job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by an aggregator.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"multiplyTask":{"aggregatorPubkey":"GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR"}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by a big.

```json
{"tasks":[{"cacheTask":{"cacheItems":[{"variableName":"TEN","job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}]}},{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"multiplyTask":{"big":"${TEN}"}}]}
```

fields.name: scalar
fields.description: Specifies a scalar to multiply by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Specifies an aggregator to multiply by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: job
fields.description: A job whose result is computed before multiplying our numerical input by that result.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OndoUsdyTask
messages.description:
OndoUsdyTask represents a task that computes the price of USDY relative to USD using a
/ specified strategy.

fields.name: strategy
fields.description: The strategy used to determine the price of USDY.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: OracleTask
messages.description:
Fetch the current price of a Solana oracle protocol.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The current price of an on-chain oracle.

_**Example**_: The Switchboard SOL/USD oracle price.

```json
{ "oracleTask": { "switchboardAddress": "GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR" } }
```

_**Example**_: The Pyth SOL/USD oracle price.

```json
{ "oracleTask": { "pythAddress": "H6ARHf6YXhGYeQfUzQNGk6rDNnLBQKrenN712K4AQJEG" } }
```

_**Example**_: The Chainlink SOL/USD oracle price.

```json
{ "oracleTask": { "chainlinkAddress": "CcPVS9bqyXbD9cLnTbhhHazLsrua8QMFUHTutPtjyDzq" } }
```

fields.name: switchboard_address
fields.description: Mainnet address of a Switchboard feed. Switchboard is decentralized and allows anyone to build their own feed.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyth_address
fields.description: Mainnet address for a Pyth feed. A full list can be found here: https://pyth.network/price-feeds/
fields.label: optional

fields.name: chainlink_address
fields.description: Mainnet address for a Chainlink feed. A full list can be found here: https://docs.chain.link/docs/solana/data-feeds-solana
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pyth_allowed_confidence_interval
fields.description:
Value (as a percentage) that the lower bound confidence interval is of the actual value.
/ Confidence intervals that are larger that this treshold are rejected.
/
/ The confidence interval should be provided as a raw percentage value. For example, to
/ represent 10%, enter the value as 10, not 0.1.

Deprecated "pyth_allowed_confidence_interval"
fields.label: optional

fields.label: optional

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The RPC provider to use for the swap.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: PerpMarketTask

fields.description: Market address for a drift perpetual market. A full list can be found here: https://github.com/drift-labs/protocol-v1/blob/master/sdk/src/constants/markets.ts

fields.label: optional

messages.name: PowTask
messages.description:
Round the current running result to an exponential power.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result.

_**Returns**_: The input raised to an exponential power.

_**Example**_: Raise 2 to the power of 3, 2^3

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":2}},{"powTask":{"scalar":3}}]}
```

fields.name: scalar
fields.description: Take the working value to the exponent of value.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Take the working value to the exponent of the aggregators value.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: PumpAmmLpTokenPriceTask

fields.name: pool_address
fields.description: Required. The address of the liquidity pool in the Pump AMM.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: x_price_job
fields.description: Required. The job to execute to fetch the price of the pool x token
fields.label: optional

fields.name: y_price_job
fields.description: Required. The job to execute
fields.label: optional

messages.name: PumpAmmTask

fields.name: pool_address
fields.description: Required. The address of the liquidity pool in the Pump AMM.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: in_amount
fields.description:
Optional. The input token amount for the swap.
/ - This value should in full units of the input token.
/ - Default value: `1` (Swap 1 full token).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: max_slippage
fields.description:
Optional. The maximum allowed slippage for the swap, expressed as a percentage.
/ - Example: `0.5` represents 0.5% slippage tolerance.
/ - Default value: `3` (3% slippage tolerance).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: is_x_for_y
fields.description:
Optional. Indicates the swap direction:
/ - `true`: Swapping token X for token Y.
/ - `false`: Swapping token Y for token X.
/ - Default value: `true`.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: RegexExtractTask

fields.name: pattern
fields.description:
The regular expression pattern to match against the input string.
/ Uses the fancy-regex Rust crate syntax.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: group_number
fields.description:
The capture group number to extract (0 returns full match, 1+ returns respective capture group).
/ Defaults to 0 if not specified.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: RoundTask
messages.description:
Round the current running result to a set number of decimal places.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result.

_**Returns**_: The running result rounded to a set number of decimal places.

_**Example**_: Round down the running resul to 8 decimal places

```json
{ "roundTask": { "method": "METHOD_ROUND_DOWN", "decimals": 8 } }
```

fields.name: method
fields.description: The rounding method to use.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: decimals
fields.description: The number of decimals to round to.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SanctumLstPriceTask
messages.description: Grab the price of an Sanctum LST relative to SOL.

fields.name: lst_mint
fields.description:
The address of the LST mint.
/
/ e.g. INF - 5oVNBeEEQvYi1cX3ir8Dx5n1P7pdxydbGF2X4TxVusJm
fields.label: optional

fields.name: skip_epoch_check
fields.description: Allow the check to see if the LST was cranked for the current epoch to be skipped.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SecretsTask
messages.description:
Securely request secrets from a Switchboard SecretsServer that are owned by a specific authority. Any secrets that are returned for the current feed will then be unwrapped into variables to be accessed later.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The input

_**Example**_: SecretsTask

```json
{ "secretsTask": { "authority": "Accb21tUCWocJea6Uk3DgrNZawgmKegDVeHw8cGMDPi5" } }
```

fields.name: authority
fields.description: The authority of the secrets that are to be requested.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url of the server to request secrets from. The default is https://api.secrets.switchboard.xyz.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SubtractTask
messages.description:
This task will subtract a numerical input by a scalar value from a job of subtasks, an aggregator, or a big.

_**Input**_: The current running numerical result output from a scalar value, an aggregator, a job of subtasks or a big.

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by subtracting by a job of subtasks.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"subtractTask":{"job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by an aggregator.

```json
{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"subtractTask":{"aggregatorPubkey":"GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR"}}]}
```

_**Example**_: Returns the numerical result by multiplying by a big.

```json
{"tasks":[{"cacheTask":{"cacheItems":[{"variableName":"TEN","job":{"tasks":[{"valueTask":{"value":10}}]}}]}},{"valueTask":{"value":100}},{"subtractTask":{"big":"${TEN}"}}]}
```

fields.name: scalar
fields.description: Specifies a scalar to subtract by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Specifies an aggregator to subtract by.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: job
fields.description: A job whose result is computed before subtracting our numerical input by that result.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SysclockOffsetTask
messages.description: Return the difference between an oracle's clock and the current timestamp at `SYSVAR_CLOCK_PUBKEY`.

messages.name: Task
messages.description: Represents a singular operation performed by an oracle to yield an eventual numerical result.

messages.name: TurboEthRedemptionRateTask
messages.description: Fetches tETH/WETH redemption rate

messages.name: TwapTask
messages.description:
Takes a twap over a set period for a certain aggregator. Aggregators have an optional history buffer account storing the last N accepted results. The TwapTask will iterate over an aggregators history buffer and calculate the time weighted average of the samples within a given time period.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: The time weighted average of an aggregator over a given time period.

_**Example**_: The 1hr Twap of the SOL/USD Aggregator, requiring at least 60 samples.

```json
{ "twapTask": { "aggregatorPubkey": "GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR", "period": 3600, "minSamples": 60, "weightByPropagationTime": true  } }
```

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: The target aggregator for the TWAP.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: period
fields.description: Period, in seconds, the twap should account for
fields.label: optional

fields.name: weight_by_propagation_time
fields.description: Weight samples by their propagation time
fields.label: optional

fields.name: min_samples
fields.description: Minimum number of samples in the history to calculate a valid result
fields.label: optional

fields.name: ending_unix_timestamp
fields.description: Ending unix timestamp to collect values up to
fields.label: optional

fields.name: ending_unix_timestamp_task
fields.description: Execute the task to get the ending unix timestamp
fields.label: optional

messages.name: UniswapExchangeRateTask
messages.description: Fetch the swap price from UniSwap.

fields.name: in_token_address
fields.description: The input token address.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: out_token_address
fields.description: The output token address.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: in_token_amount
fields.description: The amount of tokens to swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: slippage
fields.description: The allowable slippage in percent for the swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The RPC provider to use for the swap.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the Uniswap exchange to use.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: UnixTimeTask
messages.description: Get current time in seconds since Unix epoch.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: The offset to subtract from the current time.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ValueTask
messages.description:
Returns a specified value.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: A numerical result.

_**Example**_: Returns the value 10

```json
{"valueTask": {"value": 10} }
```

_**Example**_: Returns the currentRound result of an aggregator

```json
{"valueTask": {"aggregatorPubkey": "GvDMxPzN1sCj7L26YDK2HnMRXEQmQ2aemov8YBtPS7vR"} }
```

_**Example**_: Returns the value stored in a CacheTask variable

```json
{"valueTask": {"big": "${ONE}"} }
```

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value that will be returned from this task.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: Specifies an aggregatorr to pull the value of.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: big
fields.description: A stringified big.js. `Accepts variable expansion syntax.`
fields.label: optional

fields.name: hex
fields.description: A stringified hex number (0x prefix is optional).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: utf8
fields.description: A utf8 string.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: WebsocketTask
messages.description:
Opens and maintains a websocket for light speed data retrieval.

_**Input**_: None

_**Returns**_: String representation of the websocket subscription message.

_**Example**_: Opens a coinbase websocket

```json
{ "websocketTask": { "url": "wss://ws-feed.pro.coinbase.com", "subscription": "{\"type\":\"subscribe\",\"product_ids\":[\"BTC-USD\"],\"channels\":[\"ticker\",{\"name\":\"ticker\",\"product_ids\":[\"BTC-USD\"]}]}", "maxDataAgeSeconds": 15, "filter": "$[?(@.type == 'ticker' && @.product_id == 'BTC-USD')]" } }
```

fields.name: url
fields.description: The websocket url.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: subscription
fields.description: The websocket message to notify of a new subscription.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: max_data_age_seconds
fields.description: Minimum amount of time required between when the horses are taking out.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Incoming message JSONPath filter.
/ Example: "$[?(@.channel == 'ticker' && @.market == 'BTC/USD')]"
fields.label: optional

fields.name: step_job
fields.description: median task containing the job definitions to fetch the STEP/USD price
fields.label: optional

fields.name: step_aggregator_pubkey
fields.description: existing aggregator pubkey for STEP/USD
fields.label: optional

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
